qas.question: Along with Eisenhower, Macmillan and de Gaulle, what leader attended the Four Powers Paris Summit?
What did Khrushchev demand that Eisenhower do?
Along with reducing nuclear weapons, what was to have been the topic of conversation at the Four Power Paris Summit?
What did Eisenhower blame for ruining the summit?
In what year was the Four Power Paris Summit intended to take place?

context: The <a4_0>1960<a4_0/> Four Power Paris Summit between President Dwight Eisenhower, <a0_0>Nikita Khrushchev<a0_0/>, Harold Macmillan and Charles de Gaulle collapsed because of the incident. Eisenhower refused to accede to Khrushchev's demands that he <a1_0>apologize<a1_0/>. Therefore, Khrushchev would not take part in the summit. Up until this event, Eisenhower felt he had been making progress towards better relations with the Soviet Union. Nuclear arms reduction and <a2_0>Berlin<a2_0/> were to have been discussed at the summit. Eisenhower stated it had all been ruined because of that "<a3_0>stupid U-2 business<a3_0/>".
